DataElement.preferredDefinition: A categorization to indicate a level of severity for a protocol deviation. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. NOTE: Good clinical practice recommends that deviations be summarized by site and by category as part of the report of study results so that the possible importance of the deviations to the findings of the study can be assessed. Compare to protocol violation. [See ICH E3]_Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.

Concepts.definition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. (CDISC Glossary)

Property.preferredDefinition: Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

Concepts.definition: Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. NOTE: Good clinical practice recommends that deviations be summarized by site and by category as part of the report of study results so that the possible importance of the deviations to the findings of the study can be assessed. Compare to protocol violation. [See ICH E3]_Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Will affect major endpoint data integrity or will have a major impact on participant safety or ethical concerns

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Will affect major endpoint data integrity or will have a major impact on participant safety or ethical concerns
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Major deviation that will affect major endpoint data integrity or will have a major impact on participant safety or ethical concerns

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No meaningful effect on data integrity and no meaningful risk to participant safety

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No meaningful effect on data integrity and no meaningful risk to participant safety
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Minor protocol deviation with no meaningful effect on data integrity and no meaningful risk to participant safety

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Potential to affect data integrity or jeopardize participant safety

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Potential to affect data integrity or jeopardize participant safety
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Moderate deviation with the potential to affect data integrity or jeopardize participant safety

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
